commit_message:
Fix instack-undercloud PEP8 failures and requirements constraints

PEP8 have new changes that make invalid escapes a hard failure.
Also, it's failing on the requirements check.

Also the build-openstack-releasenotes job taker the setup info
from master, as we do not have master anymore we can not run the
build-openstack-releasenotes job.

This submission fixes:
- Unit tests failing with scaping incorrectly backslashes.
- Lower constraints.
- Requirements.
- Test requirements.

Closes-Bug: 1805583
Change-Id: I3a620ca13eaf7ca0e8d1e560ffeb30d25f4d82c5
(cherry picked from commit 0b9002106a5e56da09d5212926913062e1abb13c)

messages: [{'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-29 10:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-11-29 17:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-11-30 15:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-12-04 11:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 10:35:15.000000000', 'message': 'Escape JSON rendered in templates

Dynamic Redfish emulator uses Jinja templates to render JSON
documents out of the values it gathers fromm the backend
hypervisor. Sometimes these hypervisor-supplied values can contain
literals that are special to JSON serialization. Unless escaped
properly, such conflicting literals will surely ruin the entire
JSON document.

This change elicits Jinja and Flask template filters that
circumvent this problem.

Change-Id: Ie3f2e1b68ab93a701adf666bdca9cf3d227c0c57
'}, {'created': '2018-11-29 17:15:49.000000000', 'message': 'Escape JSON rendered in templates

Dynamic Redfish emulator uses Jinja templates to render JSON
documents out of the values it gathers fromm the backend
hypervisor. Sometimes these hypervisor-supplied values can contain
literals that are special to JSON serialization. Unless escaped
properly, such conflicting literals will surely ruin the entire
JSON document.

This change elicits Jinja and Flask template filters that
circumvent this problem.

Change-Id: Ie3f2e1b68ab93a701adf666bdca9cf3d227c0c57
'}]
commit_message:
Escape JSON rendered in templates

Dynamic Redfish emulator uses Jinja templates to render JSON
documents out of the values it gathers fromm the backend
hypervisor. Sometimes these hypervisor-supplied values can contain
literals that are special to JSON serialization. Unless escaped
properly, such conflicting literals will surely ruin the entire
JSON document.

This change elicits Jinja and Flask template filters that
circumvent this problem.

Change-Id: Ie3f2e1b68ab93a701adf666bdca9cf3d227c0c57

[{'created': '2018-11-30 18:55:12.000000000', 'message': 'Move port validation support into the driver

Each firewall driver have specific checks to do on port validation (like
checks if the VIF port type corresponds to a type supported by the driver
(aka the SDN controller)). This patch adds two methods to the driver
interface to validate if the VM or the router port is supported (just
have to return a boolean).

Change-Id: I8fdf0956ac5428558aae413e610d13c4a4a56273
Closes-Bug: #1803723
(cherry picked from commit 2a7994851cc0767e6a7b192a4101e8b43681ae6a)
'}]
commit_message:
Move port validation support into the driver

Each firewall driver have specific checks to do on port validation (like
checks if the VIF port type corresponds to a type supported by the driver
(aka the SDN controller)). This patch adds two methods to the driver
interface to validate if the VM or the router port is supported (just
have to return a boolean).

Change-Id: I8fdf0956ac5428558aae413e610d13c4a4a56273
Closes-Bug: #1803723
(cherry picked from commit 2a7994851cc0767e6a7b192a4101e8b43681ae6a)

commit_message:
Add namespaceSelector support for NetworkPolicies

This patch adds namespaceSelector support for ingress and egress
Network Policies.

In addition it handles the case where either no from/to or not ports
section appears on the ingress or egress block

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Change-Id: I7bfb1275221b76ad811ac6baff99e642d31f7e0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-30 18:47:28.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to disable yum update with gating repo

Previously when the gating repo was enabled, we would blindly yum update
with the repo. This probably shouldn't be the case as we should just be
installing or updating the new packages after the repo has been
installed. However to maintain backwards compatibility, a new variable
called ib_gating_repo_update has been created with the default of True.
To disable the yum update after isntalling built repo, set this to
false.

Change-Id: I5172134738b5b3d5146e45f1e0a7720b6e1d5a2c
Related-Bug: #1796639

commit_message:
Add ability to disable yum update with gating repo

Previously when the gating repo was enabled, we would blindly yum update
with the repo. This probably shouldn't be the case as we should just be
installing or updating the new packages after the repo has been
installed. However to maintain backwards compatibility, a new variable
called ib_gating_repo_update has been created with the default of True.
To disable the yum update after isntalling built repo, set this to
false.

Change-Id: I5172134738b5b3d5146e45f1e0a7720b6e1d5a2c
Closes-Bug: #1796639

commit_message:
Make sure ovs bridge is created before setting mac-table-size

After [1] puppet-ovn is setting mac-table-size using ovs-vsctl which
requires the bridge to exist in advance or it will fail.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580114/

Change-Id: Ic54ec0bd81817982559e80bef1f152063073e5e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-26 08:38:43.000000000', 'message': "Set Tempest's service_availability setting for Trove

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].trove is true then, trove test will run
or if [service_availability].trove is false then, all trove related tests either
in trove tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

Currently this setting for trove service[1] is in devstack lib/tempest
which is being removed by - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/

For better maintenance, we are moving all tempest non-owned service setting
to service devstack plugin side.

This commit add the setting of trove service on trove devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/trove-tempest-plugin/tree/trove_tempest_plugin/config.py#n17

commit_message:
Set Tempest's service_availability setting for Trove

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].trove is true then, trove test will run
or if [service_availability].trove is false then, all trove related tests either
in trove tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

Currently this setting for trove service[1] is in devstack lib/tempest
which is being removed by - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/

For better maintenance, we are moving all tempest non-owned service setting
to service devstack plugin side.

This commit add the setting of trove service on trove devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/trove-tempest-plugin/tree/trove_tempest_plugin/config.py#n17

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619973/
Change-Id: Ie3c6bab6e0be9dfcfe29ec3f412e704f3ad79d61

commit_message:
Use no-op drivers for Octavia in gate

Continue to test Heat's interaction with the Octavia API without relying on
Octavia's interaction with Nova, Neutron &c. which is known to be unstable.

Change-Id: I8765aceee09ada3086abc704b7f73ce240e21847
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/621347/
(cherry picked from commit 866864f7e5973053edcd9de59caab05790729964
 and 82e30159b59d719b1654c7f138f4e52fe8fee1c6)

messages:

> this broke opendaylight

What's broken and why? I would be good to provide at least a bug reference."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 02:43:19.000000000', 'message': "Don't allocate pseudo-TTY when creating containers

With a pseudo terminal, service is not treated as a daemon
and signals would not work as expected.

Change-Id: I16aa29a7924df51659d973a81d8005ae3d86f57b
Related-Bug: #1799642
(cherry picked from commit 48bae90e8f12124dc4b7adb2bb38df1d114ff186)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't allocate pseudo-TTY when creating containers

With a pseudo terminal, service is not treated as a daemon
and signals would not work as expected.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-25 21:22:25.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when deleting resources

Sometimes when deleting resources, we use parent resources in api
calls. If the parent resource is deleted then the children
could be assumed to be deleted. So ignore those translations errors
and return unresolved values when accessing properties.

Change-Id: I2392b5c46920ac6da518fe33bdcba3e7a9fe17a8
Story: #1747836
Task: 23278
(cherry picked from commit 26f8a70a1ebb8c4bb5be6d0255ae11c721bc19d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when deleting resources

Sometimes when deleting resources, we use parent resources in api
calls. If the parent resource is deleted then the children
could be assumed to be deleted. So ignore those translations errors
and return unresolved values when accessing properties.

Change-Id: I2392b5c46920ac6da518fe33bdcba3e7a9fe17a8
Story: #1747836
Task: 23278
(cherry picked from commit 26f8a70a1ebb8c4bb5be6d0255ae11c721bc19d2)

Plain Ubuntu image are still based on Xenial

Even if we are not really testing plain images much, let's make clear
that we didn't test any hadoop stuff on bionic yet.

messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-03 22:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-12-04 10:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-03 22:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'firstboot: make rc-local start after cloud-init

The change is required because the cloud-init user (centos, ubuntu,
cloud-user, ...) is used in the firstboot code.
All distributions where vanilla can be deployed are based
on systemd.

Story: 2004479
Task: 28194

Change-Id: I9d8a626b84d5d3c2a91348895cded5fd32ded52a
(cherry picked from commit 578cb4824bfa87ecc7ae196656c49012585738c7)
'}]
commit_message:
firstboot: make rc-local start after cloud-init

The change is required because the cloud-init user (centos, ubuntu,
cloud-user, ...) is used in the firstboot code.
All distributions where vanilla can be deployed are based
on systemd.

Story: 2004479
Task: 28194

Change-Id: I9d8a626b84d5d3c2a91348895cded5fd32ded52a
(cherry picked from commit 578cb4824bfa87ecc7ae196656c49012585738c7)

explicitly.

[{'created': '2018-11-27 14:30:51.000000000', 'message': 'Update doc to use chrony instead of ntp

ansible-hardening defaults to using chrony rather than ntp. Installing
ntp in the target host preparation step results in it being
uninstalled later by ansible-hardning in favor of chrony.

Change-Id: I04165292b8f013f0948f154041bd90b0fccb5c5f
'}]
commit_message:
Update doc to use chrony instead of ntp

ansible-hardening defaults to using chrony rather than ntp. Installing
ntp in the target host preparation step results in it being
uninstalled later by ansible-hardning in favor of chrony.

Change-Id: I04165292b8f013f0948f154041bd90b0fccb5c5f

commit_message:
Fall back to www_authenthicate_uri

The [keystone_authtoken]/auth_uri setting was deprecated in
favour of [keystone_authtoken]/www_authenticate_uri. This
commit uses the new setting as the fallback if
[clients_keystone]/auth_uri has not been set.

Change-Id: I4b6e254b1344865e3775948a8bbf1e9aac196e4f
Story: #2004434
Task: #28097

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1
(cherry picked from commit bad27d3886797517811ade604abd8a9a91cc8a2e)
'}]
commit_message:
Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1
(cherry picked from commit bad27d3886797517811ade604abd8a9a91cc8a2e)

commit_message:
Stop undercloud upgrade procedure if deployment tasks fail

Previously if deployment tasks fail, the undercloud/standalone upgrade
would continue with post-upgrade and online upgrade tasks. This is now
fixed.

Change-Id: Ia749c01602214df326edf52b855e4a2a43c6b3c2
Closes-Bug: #1805836

The tasks were incorrectly named, those running on physical host
were labeled as container and vice versa.  This patches fixes that.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-03 14:19:56.000000000', 'message': "Lowercase hostname when using it as K8s nodeName

kuryr-daemon is watching K8s API for new pods appearing on it's node. To
identify such pods nodeName property of pod is used. In
non-containerized deployments we're assuming that node's hostname is the
nodeName. Turns out that K8s is lowercasing it before making it the
nodeName.  We should do the same, otherwise kuryr-daemon will never find
it's pods.

Change-Id: I2bc6b78823e888001b93284b6efa962fad42a37b
Closes-Bug: 1806062
"}]
commit_message:
Lowercase hostname when using it as K8s nodeName

kuryr-daemon is watching K8s API for new pods appearing on it's node. To
identify such pods nodeName property of pod is used. In
non-containerized deployments we're assuming that node's hostname is the
nodeName. Turns out that K8s is lowercasing it before making it the
nodeName.  We should do the same, otherwise kuryr-daemon will never find
it's pods.

Change-Id: I2bc6b78823e888001b93284b6efa962fad42a37b
Closes-Bug: 1806062

commit_message:
devstack: parametrize openshift version fetching

Up until now the url included version. With this change it will be
possible to test with different openshift releases by just changing the
openshift binary version variable.

Change-Id: Ic40a57a555ced84240b86b389c12bed8da7b79bc
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <celebdor@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 12:52:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix updating amphora images

The octavia_amp_image.yml playbook is not idempotent because it is
missing some conditional logic and uses an incorrect result variable
name for the `os_image_facts` module (albeit following the module
documentation).

This change also updates the use of the `id` key to the required
`name` key in the `os_image` module.

Also, the fact get and image deletion need to be done by the service
account, not the cloud admin account.

Finally, these tasks all have the same conditional, so we put them
all into a block.

Change-Id: I52e111fffe9a60c879c967c94a895ae272d98fcd
(cherry picked from commit 08f1a28085be653f83512494bcab6945bb87da1e)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-26 15:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix updating amphora images

The octavia_amp_image.yml playbook is not idempotent because it is
missing some conditional logic and uses an incorrect result variable
name for the `os_image_facts` module (albeit following the module
documentation).

This change also updates the use of the `id` key to the required
`name` key in the `os_image` module.

Also, the fact get and image deletion need to be done by the service
account, not the cloud admin account.

Finally, these tasks all have the same conditional, so we put them
all into a block.

Change-Id: I52e111fffe9a60c879c967c94a895ae272d98fcd
(cherry picked from commit 08f1a28085be653f83512494bcab6945bb87da1e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix updating amphora images

The octavia_amp_image.yml playbook is not idempotent because it is
missing some conditional logic and uses an incorrect result variable
name for the `os_image_facts` module (albeit following the module
documentation).

This change also updates the use of the `id` key to the required
`name` key in the `os_image` module.

Also, the fact get and image deletion need to be done by the service
account, not the cloud admin account.

Finally, these tasks all have the same conditional, so we put them
all into a block.

Change-Id: I52e111fffe9a60c879c967c94a895ae272d98fcd
(cherry picked from commit 08f1a28085be653f83512494bcab6945bb87da1e)

commit_message:
Remove object-store permission for Clusters panel

Object-store is not needed for managing Trove clusters.

This change removes object-store permission causing that Cluster panel
will be registered even if object-store is unavailable.

Change-Id: I72a9cac16625ff6745b97d65b467e5227bd24045
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

When we were upgrading multiple nodes at the same time,
e.g. controllers, and a taks on one of the nodes failed, the other
nodes would keep upgrading. This is undersirable and can be fixed by

Change-Id: Iad2b5e32e955da41af4d2b8dd8ad8aa1eb5dffa9

commit_message:
Stop upgrade if a task on one node fails

When we were upgrading multiple nodes at the same time,
e.g. controllers, and a taks on one of the nodes failed, the other
nodes would keep upgrading. This is undersirable and can be fixed by
adding any_errors_fatal to the Ansible plays.

Change-Id: Iad2b5e32e955da41af4d2b8dd8ad8aa1eb5dffa9
Closes-Bug: #1804468
(cherry picked from commit 021d1b1efba054a743f73dc596e1b80d38db0bbd)

subject: Fix instack-undercloud PEP8 failures and requirements constraints
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-22 08:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-22 15:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-22 16:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 08:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 08:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 09:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 10:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-23 11:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-23 14:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-11-26 14:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

We had a similar issue (with lower constraints) and we directly changed the requirement file:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613267/

it was master though so not really important, make similar review and see what happen, Iwould say :)'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-26 16:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-26 19:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-26 19:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Alternatively we could just ignore that test since this release will never be supported on the version of Python where this is a problem.

But if this gets the tests passing it works for me too.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck - 4 hours queued'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-26 23:20:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

> recheck - 4 hours queued

This has no effect if the patch is already waiting in the queue. Recheck is only useful if the patch has completed the test jobs in the first place.

Also, the patch has already failed the requirements job, so there will need to be more changes: http://logs.openstack.org/67/619467/11/check/requirements-check/50cea43/job-output.txt.gz

You can either wait for the rest of the jobs to report and make sure they're working or go ahead and push a new patch set which will trigger a whole new set of jobs (and kick it to the end of the queue, unfortunately)."}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 06:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 07:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 08:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 13:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

Firstly, I don't see any bug id in commit message. What problem are we trying to solve?

This project is deprecated and will be removed soon. All tests should run on python2 at least for rocky/queens branch as they were developed using python2 and will use python2 downstream."}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(3 comments)

Tested with >= and with tox line removed and it passed the requirements-check test.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:15:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1

LGTM, but need another look to Sergii's comment."}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-27 17:42:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> Firstly, I don't see any bug id in commit message. What problem are
 > we trying to solve?

The problems are listed in the commit message. 

 > 
 > This project is deprecated and will be removed soon. All tests
 > should run on python2 at least for rocky/queens branch as they were
 > developed using python2 and will use python2 downstream.

The commit message is probably a bit misleading here. The tests aren't being run with python 3 any differently from how they were before, but pep8 made some changes that relate to support for a future version of python 3 where invalid escapes will be hard failures. We need to fix or ignore that test so ci can pass on this repo.

I'm not sure why the requirements would suddenly have become a problem, but maybe we drifted from global-requirements and it's just being noticed now. In any case, it needs to be fixed as well or nothing can merge.

So the commit message could probably be updated to better reflect the cause of the pep8 failure, but otherwise this is correct."}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-28 08:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-11-28 14:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-28 15:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Hmm, the releasenotes failure might be legitimate:

config directory doesn't contain a conf.py file (releasenotes/source)

I'm not sure how this would have been working before though. :-/"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-28 15:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Hmm, no. That message is nonsense. I can clearly see that there is a conf.py in that directory:

[fedora@openstack instack-undercloud]$ ls releasenotes/source/conf.py 
releasenotes/source/conf.py

I think the release notes job may be running with master instead of stable/rocky: http://logs.openstack.org/67/619467/20/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/9cdee62/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-28_08_18_32_224868

We may need to talk to infra to figure out why that is.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

@bnemec I asked to mwhahaha and it seems that the config is always taken from master, so we need to remove that job. Hopefully this is the last thing broken in this repo xD'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:25:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2

Works for me. There shouldn't really be any new release notes in this repo anyway."}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-29 11:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Im not sure if all the errors in:

http://logs.openstack.org/67/619467/21/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-upgrades/2c490d0/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/mistral-db-manage.log.txt.gz

are related, the issue is in the UC installation, there is a mistral workflow timing out.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-11-29 11:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-12-03 11:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-03 15:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix instack-undercloud PEP8 failures and requirements constraints

PEP8 have new changes that make invalid escapes a hard failure.
Also, it's failing on the requirements check.

Also the build-openstack-releasenotes job taker the setup info
from master, as we do not have master anymore we can not run the
build-openstack-releasenotes job.

This submission fixes:
- Unit tests failing with scaping incorrectly backslashes.
- Lower constraints.
- Requirements.
- Test requirements.

Closes-Bug: 1805583
Change-Id: I3a620ca13eaf7ca0e8d1e560ffeb30d25f4d82c5

subject: Monitor VIPs
messages:
[{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-12-04 00:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-12-04 08:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Manually tested with gnocchi. The old behaviour is that a restart of systemd-networkd on the machine hosting the vip causes the vip to go down permanently. New behaviour is the monitor notices and brings it back.

Old behaviour: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/Xy9FtHdH8Z/
New behaviour: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/n4dPQsKMv5/'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-12-04 08:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Validated with consecutive successful test runs of the Octavia HA bundles too.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 00:07:52.000000000', 'message': 'Monitor VIPs

The interface was failing to setup monitoring for Virtual IPs. If for
some reason a VIP failed on an instance corosync would fail to notice
it.

This change adds the op monitor setting to monitor VIPs.

Change-Id: If885340f04b8834fa4604ab742c7facfc6f316ad
'}]
commit_message:
Monitor VIPs

The interface was failing to setup monitoring for Virtual IPs. If for
some reason a VIP failed on an instance corosync would fail to notice
it.

This change adds the op monitor setting to monitor VIPs.

Change-Id: If885340f04b8834fa4604ab742c7facfc6f316ad

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Iea166562d2fbc6785c337d5c7c600c2e0a41422a
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 02:56:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add ipmi_do_timeout_disable to avoid problematic IPMI command

The IPMI driver unconditionally instructed the BMC not automatically
clear boot flag valid bit if Chassis Control command not received within
60-second timeout (countdown restarts when a Chassis Control command is
received).  Some BMCs do not support setting this.  Sending the command
aborts the node boot.

A new driver option ``ipmi_do_timeout_disable`` is added to bypass
sending this command.

Change-Id: I1dda3cf3e4b7b888ed9d8931c8ede3a918dd01f4
Story: 2004266

A new driver option ``ipmi_disable_timeout`` is added to bypass

commit_message:
Add ipmi_disable_timeout to avoid problematic IPMI command

The IPMI driver unconditionally instructed the BMC not automatically
clear boot flag valid bit if Chassis Control command not received within
60-second timeout (countdown restarts when a Chassis Control command is
received).  Some BMCs do not support setting this.  Sending the command
aborts the node boot.

A new driver option ``ipmi_disable_timeout`` is added to bypass
sending this command.

Change-Id: I1dda3cf3e4b7b888ed9d8931c8ede3a918dd01f4
Story: 2004266

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I610a974022585b202f44bb32138042c7d2da6320
Closes-Bug:#1801821

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-15 07:11:20.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ief7b5b611bf55c057b0466d5b75154669eb7e49c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ief7b5b611bf55c057b0466d5b75154669eb7e49c

Yes, I can configure it to run less frequently or we can stick to pushing images only on commits, they are less frequent that once a day.
I'm also playing now with adding tag for release and branch but zuul today is really slow..."}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-29 14:23:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Actually I think that if we create images with release tags then probably we don't need tagging with timestamp (already removed to avoid spamming images) and it will be better to run push only after commits instead of every day. Unless we want master to always have latest security updates for alpine and python images, then building master every day is probably good idea."}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-30 07:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-30 09:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-30 11:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-30 12:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

OK, now I think it's working fine.
It will create `master` tag by default and (hopefully) tag with proper tags on release."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-11-30 16:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-12-03 07:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-12-03 12:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26141, 'date': '2018-12-03 12:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-12-03 12:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-12-03 13:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-12-03 15:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Too long first commit message line. Other than that looks fine.'}, {'account_id': 26141, 'date': '2018-12-04 06:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Push monasca/base image on commit, periodicaly and on release

Remove docker `files` check.
This check works only in `check` and `gate` steps, but is not
functioning properly in `post` step and always fail resulting
in not pushed images of monasca/base.

Change-Id: Id960e831948ee87e078688e43b864b22a6ee11ae

commit_message:
Pass role ids to trust if possible

currently Heat fails to create a stack requiring deferred auth with
trusts when user happens to have a role assigned for which a different
but similar named role exist in another Keystone domain.

This patch makes Heat to attempt extract role IDs from the
auth_token_info first and pass those to Keystone trust if found.

Change-Id: Ic9207e3f027f9c56c14d548d404ecc0c2427f326
Story: 2002613
Task: 22237

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] Agent side router gateway IP rate limit

This patch implements the L3 agent side router gateway IP rate
limit. For routers in centralized snat node (network node),
the tc rules will be set on the corresponding device in router
namespace:
    1. Legacy and HA router, qrouter-namespace and qg-device
    2. Dvr (edge) router, snat namespace and qg-device

If gateway IP rate limit was set, then under the same router,
all the VMs without floating IP will share the bandwidth.

Partially-Implements blueprint: router-gateway-ip-qos
Closes-Bug: #1757044

commit_message:
Fix racy conditions with Ceph caps updating

The sed commands are replaced with simpler methods of extracting
the cephx cap keys.

Change-Id: I783c360569bf17b16d128544b5ab11cb1ce9a7ed

i don't think we should be updating the hosts file"}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@chris.wedgewood I'm open to suggestions, however ceph.conf is a mount point. So the file is RO to the pods. Ultimately we should be using IPs _or_ SRV records for resolving ceph-mon records. While defining IPs isn't elastic, SRV records are. However that doesn't solve the issue when DNS is offline."}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-06 01:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-11-06 05:45:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

can't we lookup IPs and rewrite config to use those?
i don't think they change during the lifetime of a pod usually"}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-06 21:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@chris wedgewood, you cannot write over /etc/ceph/ceph.conf. It's an RO file, and a mount point. There is no way to update it after the pod is started using /etc/hosts is the only option."}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-07 06:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-07 14:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-07 16:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 29053, 'date': '2018-11-08 16:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-08 19:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-08 19:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-08 21:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-09 05:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-09 05:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-09 18:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-10 23:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-15 02:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2018-11-15 02:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
Switch Ceph to IPs when DNS is down

Add helper scripts that are called by a POD to switch
Ceph from DNS to IPs. This POD will loop every 5 minutes
to catch cases where the DNS might be unavailable.

On a POD's Service start switch ceph.conf to using IPs rather
then DNS.

Change-Id: I402199f55792ca9f5f28e436ff44d4a6ac9b7cf9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-30 22:06:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix - restart VLAN interface on underlying device change

When a change is needed on bond, os-net-config write the
configuration and restart nic and bond. But it does not
restart vlan on top of the bond. The results is that  all
routes for vlan interfaces are lost.

This moves the processing of VLAN's so that it run's
after any interfaces, bridges, bonds etc. Then
concatenates the restart lists from other interfaces and
do a check if 'PHYSDEV' of a VLAN interface is being
restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1806128
Related: RHBZ#1654987
Change-Id: I246da54cf02d06466f52d210f89d82ca9e2a6ef2

commit_message:
Fix - restart VLAN interface on underlying device change

When a change is needed on bond, os-net-config write the
configuration and restart nic and bond. But it does not
restart vlan on top of the bond. The results is that  all
routes for vlan interfaces are lost.

This moves the processing of VLAN's so that it run's
after any interfaces, bridges, bonds etc. Then
concatenates the restart lists from other interfaces and
do a check if 'PHYSDEV' of a VLAN interface is being
restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1806128
Related: RHBZ#1654987
Change-Id: I246da54cf02d06466f52d210f89d82ca9e2a6ef2

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7ac34fa0215114f3d7345abd183c84159a30440e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610102/
Change-Id: I0bbc17c6d15629972f3527d1fd235ed0f65e5fca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 14:01:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pacemaker tagging race condition

Change I81bc48b53068c3a5ed90266a4fd3e62bfb017835 moved image fetching
and tagging for pacemaker-managed services from step 1 to step 2. This
is also a step when the services are started, which probably
introduced a race condition for environments where pacemaker cluster
consists of more than one machine.

During the deployment you can get a lot of pcmk failures like:

failed to pull image 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/centos-binary-mariadb:pcmklatest

This only happens on non-bootstrap nodes. On bootstrap node the order
is still correct, first download and tag image, and then start the
pcmk resources. However, if non-bootstrap nodes are slower with
downloading and tagging, pacemaker there might start the resources
before the images are tagged (as the starting of resources is
controlled globally from bootstrap node).

Change-Id: Id669cc9a296a8366c7c80a5ee509bdb964b62a04
Closes-Bug: #1805826
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pacemaker tagging race condition

Change I81bc48b53068c3a5ed90266a4fd3e62bfb017835 moved image fetching
and tagging for pacemaker-managed services from step 1 to step 2. This
is also a step when the services are started, which probably
introduced a race condition for environments where pacemaker cluster
consists of more than one machine.

During the deployment you can get a lot of pcmk failures like:

failed to pull image 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/centos-binary-mariadb:pcmklatest

This only happens on non-bootstrap nodes. On bootstrap node the order
is still correct, first download and tag image, and then start the
pcmk resources. However, if non-bootstrap nodes are slower with
downloading and tagging, pacemaker there might start the resources
before the images are tagged (as the starting of resources is
controlled globally from bootstrap node).

Change-Id: Id669cc9a296a8366c7c80a5ee509bdb964b62a04
Closes-Bug: #1805826

commit_message:
Correct handling of capabilities on node update

When updating nodes we do not convert capabilities from the supported
dict representation to internal string representation. This may result
in incorrect capabilities after an update. This patch fixes it.

Also enforce alphabetical order in capabilities to prevent them
from reordering on updates.

Conflicts:
	tripleo_common/utils/nodes.py

Change-Id: I098409e5ff63b3c3719563de8144fda5bf482bdf
Closes-Bug: #1802318
(cherry picked from commit 2c225f1f2a0d371ef9603a62df6cd6210d656d67)

commit_message:
Fix osc command issue

If you have installed openstackclient and masakariclient on your
machine, then none of the openstack commands work as it fails to
load the masakari plugin.

Added 'API_NAME' global constants which osc clientmanager expects
during initialization of masakari plugin.

Change-Id: Id33bd45ee1625a23ae43090a45d8b0f9ff2bf56a
Closes-Bug: #1801689
(cherry picked from commit 71ce1fbb4a46c2da102581c9e1d0384598199ba6)

commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Change-Id: Idb3cab8a225419cf801b1ee74188dee40dff0e09
(cherry picked from commit 480e210d1db98738724014cbabc89a52b23117b3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 15:47:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix InstanceNotFound during _destroy_evacuated_instances

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests on the hypervisor and
allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change does two things in the _destroy_evacuated_instances
method:

1. Loads the evacuated instances with a read_deleted='yes'
   context when calling _get_instances_on_driver(). This
   should be fine since _get_instances_on_driver() is already
   returning deleted instances anyway (InstanceList.get_by_filters
   defaults to read deleted instances unless the filters tell
   it otherwise - which we don't in this case). This is needed
   so that things like driver.destroy() don't raise
   InstanceNotFound while lazy-loading fields on the instance.

2. Skips the call to remove_allocation_from_compute() if the
   evacuated instance is already deleted. If the instance is
   already deleted, its allocations should have been cleaned
   up by its hosting compute service (or the API).

The functional regression test is updated to show the bug is
now fixed.

Change-Id: I1f4b3540dd453650f94333b36d7504ba164192f7
Closes-Bug: #1794996

commit_message:
Fix InstanceNotFound during _destroy_evacuated_instances

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests on the hypervisor and
allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change does two things in the _destroy_evacuated_instances
method:

1. Loads the evacuated instances with a read_deleted='yes'
   context when calling _get_instances_on_driver(). This
   should be fine since _get_instances_on_driver() is already
   returning deleted instances anyway (InstanceList.get_by_filters
   defaults to read deleted instances unless the filters tell
   it otherwise - which we don't in this case). This is needed
   so that things like driver.destroy() don't raise
   InstanceNotFound while lazy-loading fields on the instance.

2. Skips the call to remove_allocation_from_compute() if the
   evacuated instance is already deleted. If the instance is
   already deleted, its allocations should have been cleaned
   up by its hosting compute service (or the API).

The functional regression test is updated to show the bug is
now fixed.

Change-Id: I1f4b3540dd453650f94333b36d7504ba164192f7
Closes-Bug: #1794996

commit_message:
Revert "Default NtpPool to an empty list"

This reverts commit 126991516a1a3cf183564d807ddbebfa054d852f.

This is breaking ci because we need to specify
multiple servers or we have sync failures.

Change-Id: I57905ad9bc1101d0152852d5404d1c84661d45ab

commit_message:
Support pre-downloading/uploading docker images

This commit allows pre-downloading docker images in devstack
and make the list of images configurable.
As a result, each zuul job can specify the list of images that
needs to be pre-downloaded and uploaded to glance.

Change-Id: I43e5f3aecf709bdbc55dfbae7cc871058f7b7c8d

[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-10-31 11:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-31 11:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/tasks/reload.yml also uses sighup

I'd not merge a restart of the containers instead of sighup kill, it will take longer to start the services, increasing downtime during upgrades and reconfigures"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-10-31 11:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-31 12:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-01 10:07:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I think this explains another issue I've seen. The nova_compute service ends up in a broken state after an upgrade. During the upgrade we HUP the nova containers [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/tasks/reload.yml"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-01 10:18:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The nova_compute service ends up in a broken state after an upgrade

That's becoz of how dumb-init forwards signals all workers, which we're trying to fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612887/.

That results in a side effect with kolla-ansible, where the HUP is treated as TERM by oslo.service, as it assumes the container processes run by kolla-ansible are not deamons for some reason. I don't see that issue in Tripleo though."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-01 10:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Raised https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1801038 for the nova-compute issue.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-01 10:32:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > The nova_compute service ends up in a broken state after an
 > upgrade
 > 
 > That's becoz of how dumb-init forwards signals all workers, which
 > we're trying to fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612887/.
 > 
 > That results in a side effect with kolla-ansible, where the HUP is
 > treated as TERM by oslo.service, as it assumes the container
 > processes run by kolla-ansible are not deamons for some reason. I
 > don't see that issue in Tripleo though.

Oh, so the oslo.service issue only applies to the workers? Surely they are not foreground?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 07:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 11:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 16:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 17:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-05 08:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This seems like a good idea to me. Would like to hear from anyone who can think of a reason why it might not be.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-11-06 07:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Sounds like a good idea - but maybe to not break anything - we should base it on a variable?'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-12 06:47:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> but maybe to not break anything - we should base it on a variable?

What do you expect to be broken? I don't see any reason to start containers with terminal by default though."}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-11-12 16:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-11-13 22:20:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > but maybe to not break anything - we should base it on a
 > variable?
 > 
 > What do you expect to be broken? I don't see any reason to start
 > containers with terminal by default though.
I agree, there should be no reason to do it. Tested and everything works fine."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-14 09:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 0d6abc63f796fcd08341faa1cf204b0772921e43'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-04 02:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 5227cde150631285641b0b48ba3e7c93f887d950'}]

commit_message:
Don't allocate pseudo-TTY when creating containers

With a pseudo terminal, service is not treated as a daemon
and signals would not work as expected.

Change-Id: I16aa29a7924df51659d973a81d8005ae3d86f57b
Related-Bug: #1799642

commit_message:
Fix in-process func tests to work with newer PasteDeploy

Apparently they changed the order of how default, global, and local config
get applied? See also: https://github.com/Pylons/pastedeploy/commit/556611a

Change-Id: Ie7322ef362b0b22898c14db7d0fcd3dafc40d473

I don't think we need this explicitly, we can just mark the option as mutable=True and then SIGHUPing the process will make oslo.config do the rest:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/reference/mutable.html"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

See live_migration_completion_timeout for a mutable config option used in the compute service.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:44:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Matt: Making the timer option mutable is a good idea, but I don't think it would be sufficient for this change. In order to force a cache refresh, I would have to do something like:

- Set the refresh timer to 1
- SIGHUP
- Wait a second
- Set the refresh timer back to whatever it was before
- SIGHUP again

...which isn't as nice a UX as just doing a single SIGHUP to clear the cache.

Am I missing some subtlety here?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Yeah I guess in addition to changing the refresh cache interval, we also need to clear the in-memory "cache" in the compute. Anyway, we should make that option mutable either in this change or in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615606/ shouldn't we?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Ah, rats, I meant to update the option help and reno in this patch.

@Matt: Yes, I agree making the conf option mutable in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615606/ is a good plan.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
SIGHUP n-cpu to clear provider tree cache

An earlier change [1] allowed
[compute]resource_provider_association_refresh to be set to zero to
disable the resource tracker's periodic refresh of its local copy of
provider traits and aggregates. To allow for out-of-band changes to
placement (e.g. via the CLI) to be picked up by the resource tracker in
this configuration (or a configuration where the timer is set to a high
value) this change clears the provider tree cache when SIGHUP is sent to
the compute service. The next periodic will repopulate it afresh from
placement.

[1] Iec33e656491848b26686fbf6fb5db4a4c94b9ea8

Change-Id: I65a7ee565ca5b3ec6c33a2fd9e39d461f7d90ed2

This looks good! I think that some documentation, explaining the settings that can be changed and the possible values/formats will be great.'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thanks, Julia and Yolanda for the comments!

Yolanda - regarding adding some documentation explaining the settings that can be changed and the possible values/formats. That would be great. The difficulty with this is that in Redfish (and in the industry in general) there are no standards for the names of BIOS settings. So every vendor uses their own. Maybe it would be helpful to add a statement to that effect?'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

about the possible settings - Redfish has Attribute registry[1] that should list all possible vendor-specific settings and other metadata, but I haven't seen any existing sample and sushy is not handling and exposing this now. 
But that would be something that can be added in future.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/AttributeRegistry.v1_2_0.json"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-23 09:57:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I understand it's work in progress, but a few comments inline. Even more importantly, the final version of the patch should have a release note attached and driver-requirements.txt should be updated with the required version of sushy."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-07-26 09:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you Bill.'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-08-16 22:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thank you so much, Bill.

I have a design suggestion. I believe that apply_configuration() and post_configuration_write_action() could substantially benefit from the use of the Redfish operation apply time. Please refer to the Redfish spec, https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0266_1.5.0.pdf, section 6.4.5 Operation apply time, pp. 41-43.

If the service supports it, the value 'OnReset' or maybe even 'Immediate' (wishful thinking ;-) could be specified when the new settings are posted. The value used could be passed to post_configuration_write_action() to inform it of what it needs to do, if anything.

Also, the spec states, "Services that support the "@Redfish.OperationApplyTime" for a given Resource Collection or action shall create a Task, and respond with an HTTP Status code of 202 with a location header set to the URI of a Task resource, if the client's request body contains "@Redfish.OperationApplyTime" in the request." Tasks are described in section 8.2 Asynchronous operations, pp. 90-91. The task could be used to definitively determine the success or failure of the operation -- no raciness :)

I expect that utilizing those features in this generic BIOS hardware interface implementation for Redfish will make it easier for vendors to tailor it to their evolving Redfish service implementations, and therefore more quickly increase its support by hardware types.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-08-20 09:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

sushy is not exposing anything related to "Operation apply time" yet.'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-08-20 21:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(8 comments)

Thanks Dmitry and Shivanand for the code review comments. I have replied in-line to the specific code comments and will make those updates in the next patch request.

Richard and Aija - thanks also for the suggestions and comments re: the ApplyTime design change: Richard - I'm assuming you mean to keep the existing logic that will work for systems that do not support ApplyTime and add additional checking and logic to use ApplyTime if it is available. Is that correct?"}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-08-20 22:08:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > Richard and Aija - thanks also for the suggestions and comments re:
 > the ApplyTime design change: Richard - I'm assuming you mean to
 > keep the existing logic that will work for systems that do not
 > support ApplyTime and add additional checking and logic to use
 > ApplyTime if it is available. Is that correct?

You're welcome, Bill.

Yes, I'm asking that for the most part the existing logic be retained. The goal of my comment is to design and implement this interface to work with systems that do _and_ do not support the new ApplyTime and Task features. As you're well aware, the Redfish standard and vendor implementations are rapidly evolving. If reasonably possible, let's lend support for all standard implementations."}, {'account_id': 28533, 'date': '2018-08-31 17:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > (8 comments)
 > >
 > > Richard and Aija - thanks also for the suggestions and comments
 > re:
 > > the ApplyTime design change: Richard - I'm assuming you mean to
 > > keep the existing logic that will work for systems that do not
 > > support ApplyTime and add additional checking and logic to use
 > > ApplyTime if it is available. Is that correct?
 > 
 > You're welcome, Bill.
 > 
 > Yes, I'm asking that for the most part the existing logic be
 > retained. The goal of my comment is to design and implement this
 > interface to work with systems that do _and_ do not support the new
 > ApplyTime and Task features. As you're well aware, the Redfish
 > standard and vendor implementations are rapidly evolving. If
 > reasonably possible, let's lend support for all standard
 > implementations.

I agree, I think it would be best to try to make use of the most feature-rich implementation that could be implemented, and then fall back into cases where a given feature is not supported. In this case, it would be for the detection of the @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime term (@Redfish.OperationApplyTime is a different concept for Actions, Create, and Delete operations).

In this case, it might make the most sense for the Ironic workflow to always have the Settings resource applied "OnReset". So, if we detect the presence of the "@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime" term, we'd ensure it's configured for "OnReset", so once all of the BIOS settings are configured, we can reset the system to have everything applied.

If "@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime" is not supported, then we can assume that the BIOS settings would be applied on the next system reset anyway.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-31 17:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-31 18:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> If "@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime" is not supported, then we can
 > assume that the BIOS settings would be applied on the next system
 > reset anyway.
I feel like we should almost just reboot by default in all cases, but the async behavior support means that we need to hold and poll until completed, and as such +1 to just putting the logic into handle both cases.

That being said, I'm slightly concerned that we will only support one of these patterns. I guess that is more reasoning to ensure we have good unit testing.'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-09-04 16:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

> I agree, I think it would be best to try to make use of the most
 > feature-rich implementation that could be implemented, and then
 > fall back into cases where a given feature is not supported. In
 > this case, it would be for the detection of the @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime
 > term (@Redfish.OperationApplyTime is a different concept for
 > Actions, Create, and Delete operations).
 > 
 > In this case, it might make the most sense for the Ironic workflow
 > to always have the Settings resource applied "OnReset". So, if we
 > detect the presence of the "@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime" term, we'd
 > ensure it's configured for "OnReset", so once all of the BIOS
 > settings are configured, we can reset the system to have everything
 > applied.
 > 
 > If "@Redfish.SettingsApplyTime" is not supported, then we can
 > assume that the BIOS settings would be applied on the next system
 > reset anyway.

Mike, thanks for the comments and confirmation on the approach. And also for the clarification on @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime vs. @Redfish.OperationApplyTime. All very helpful.

 > I feel like we should almost just reboot by default in all cases,
 > but the async behavior support means that we need to hold
 > and poll until completed, and as such +1 to just putting the
 > logic into handle both cases.
 > That being said, I'm slightly concerned that we will only
 > support one of these patterns. I guess that is more reasoning
 > to ensure we have good unit testing.

Thanks, Julia. Makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-09-05 14:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-09-06 16:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Also, the spec states, "Services that support the "@Redfish.OperationApplyTime"
 > for a given Resource Collection or action shall create a Task, and
 > respond with an HTTP Status code of 202 with a location header set
 > to the URI of a Task resource, if the client's request body
 > contains "@Redfish.OperationApplyTime" in the request." Tasks are
 > described in section 8.2 Asynchronous operations, pp. 90-91. The
 > task could be used to definitively determine the success or failure
 > of the operation -- no raciness :)

As Mike Raineri pointed out in a subsequent comment, the @Redfish.OperationApplyTime annotation only applies to POST or DELETE operations, so not applicable to the BIOS Settings update via PATCH. For PATCHing Settings, @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime is applicable and can be used, but that doesn't trigger the creation of a Redfish Task.

We'll need to issue the reboot and then poll the power state to watch for the power to become "on".  Then check the results of the BIOS update by checking the Messages and Time in the Settings resource and/or the values of the properties in the BIOS resource to determine success/fail. 

Also, based on the discussions above, it looks like we'll need to make updates to sushy to add support for the @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation. I'll create a new task for that.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-09-25 09:37:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2018-07-12 17:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add BIOS interface to Redfish hardware type

The Redfish hardware type does not currently implement the new BIOS
hardware interface.

This patch implements the Redfish BIOS interface, allowing operators to
perform BIOS configuration actions on Ironic Redfish nodes.

Change-Id: I44a2a465b08bc15465b7096b1e4838aebb460c1b

commit_message:
Add BIOS interface to Redfish hardware type

The Redfish hardware type does not currently implement the new BIOS
hardware interface.

This patch implements the Redfish BIOS interface, allowing operators to
perform BIOS configuration actions on Ironic Redfish nodes.

Change-Id: I44a2a465b08bc15465b7096b1e4838aebb460c1b
Story: 2001791
Task: 12507

commit_message:
Cephx caps update for new and post deployments

The update makes sure the Openstack service's cephx
user capabilities match best practices in terms of
security permissions after a site or software update.

Change-Id: I7c241cdb5d92463ac59c557ca7847ca5688d158b

Default NtpPool to an empty list

This way we have the same default as we always have, with only the ntp
server set.

commit_message:
Rework health check code

* Modified health check for node poll status mode to treat a node as
  healthy if it encounters an error getting server status.
* Simplified NodePollStatusHealthCheck code
* Added do_healthcheck method separate from do_check to clearly show
  health check behaviour
* Simplified NodePollUrlHealthCheck code by using tenacity
* Added more log statements

Change-Id: I76f0ef95067c81f123bf548c723e93d4cf9c2d49
Closes-Bug: 1800038

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-24 07:07:24.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] Router gateway rate limit

Now it's able to limit the router gateway IP bandwidth, aka
SNAT traffic for the VMs without floating IPs, this is suit
for all kinds of L3 routers: DVR, DVR with SNAT HA, L3 HA and
Legacy.

Update Gateway Bandwidtch Json:
{
router": {
  "external_gateway_info": {
    # Required, to determine the external network
    "network_id": "a-uuid-for-public-network",
    # the gateway rate limit, unit: mbps.
    "rate_limit": 1
    }
  }
}

If gateway IP rate limit was set, then all the VMs without
floating IP will share the bandwidth. 0 for rate_limit is
also means not limit, and only admin user could set such
value.

APIImpact
DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1596611
Change-Id: I26e22bce7edd1f93b2ac0048b61b14f858938537

for all kinds of L3 routers: DVR, DVR with SNAT HA, L3 HA and

'}, {'created': '2018-05-14 05:59:51.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] Neutron server side router gateway IP QoS

Now it's able to limit the router gateway IP bandwidth, aka
SNAT traffic for the VMs without floating IPs, this is suit
for all kinds of L3 routers: DVR, DVR with SNAT HA, L3 HA and
Legacy.

Update router gateway json:
{
router": {
  "external_gateway_info": {
    ...
    "qos_policy_id": "a-uuid"
    }
  }
}

If gateway IP rate limit was set, then all the VMs without
floating IP will share the bandwidth.

Depends-On: I815bc60f0d0fc25c2acd9900d838806f8b81adff

Closes-Bug: #1757044
Related-Bug: #1596611
Change-Id: I26e22bce7edd1f93b2ac0048b61b14f858938537

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 19:44:15.000000000', 'message': 'Separate the thread pool for health and stats update

When queue_event_streamer driver is used and RabbitMQ
is down, stats update processes occupy the thread pool
which is shared with health update processes. Then,
RabbitMQ down unexpectedly leads to delete all existing
amphorae. This commit separates the thread pool and aims
to keep the existing amphorae working even when RabbitMQ
is down.

Change-Id: I576687f5b646496ff3a00787cf5e8c27f36b9448
Task: 22929
Story: 2002937
(cherry picked from commit ad69363fc753c0689214fcdc26d6ef6c90d0d520)
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 15:33:08.000000000', 'message': 'Separate the thread pool for health and stats update

When queue_event_streamer driver is used and RabbitMQ
is down, stats update processes occupy the thread pool
which is shared with health update processes. Then,
RabbitMQ down unexpectedly leads to delete all existing
amphorae. This commit separates the thread pool and aims
to keep the existing amphorae working even when RabbitMQ
is down.

In addition to the cherry-pick from master, this patch fixes the release
note to not call out a feature but a fix instead, and drop the
deprecation of status_update_threads.

Change-Id: I576687f5b646496ff3a00787cf5e8c27f36b9448
Task: 22929
Story: 2002937

commit_message:
Separate the thread pool for health and stats update

When queue_event_streamer driver is used and RabbitMQ
is down, stats update processes occupy the thread pool
which is shared with health update processes. Then,
RabbitMQ down unexpectedly leads to delete all existing
amphorae. This commit separates the thread pool and aims
to keep the existing amphorae working even when RabbitMQ
is down.

In addition to the cherry-pick from master, this patch fixes the release
note to not call out a feature but a fix instead, and drop the
deprecation of status_update_threads.

Change-Id: I576687f5b646496ff3a00787cf5e8c27f36b9448
Task: 22929
Story: 2002937
(cherry picked from commit ad69363fc753c0689214fcdc26d6ef6c90d0d520)

The openshift-master service will fail any time it is used with a
stack update. This is because the openshift_upgrade var is not
defined, but is checked whenever tripleo_stack_action == 'UPDATE'.

This patch adds a check for openshift_upgrade being defined before
checking if it is True.

Closes-Bug: 1794824

(cherry picked from commit d295cd94b82218f62c4b564f0a3a76cc04cba549)

commit_message:
Make openshift-master service idempotent

The openshift-master service will fail any time it is used with a
stack update. This is because the openshift_upgrade var is not
defined, but is checked whenever tripleo_stack_action == 'UPDATE'.

This patch adds a check for openshift_upgrade being defined before
checking if it is True.

Closes-Bug: 1794824
Change-Id: I3a598724154a3242b777eefed9304300c45d8c29
(cherry picked from commit d295cd94b82218f62c4b564f0a3a76cc04cba549)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-19 20:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-23 04:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

At the very least https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614308/1 (
Update ansible to 2.4.6) confuses me in the context of users that have an existing OSA install (say 17.1.3) if they grab 17.1.4 should that re-run the bootstrap-aio,sh and therefore get a new ansible or do they bypass that step?

If I read https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/latest/admin/upgrades/minor-updates.html correctly that change will only impact new OSA sites?

#help?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Tony Every OSA minor upgrade involves running bootstrap-ansible.sh again, both to ensure the correct ansible version is implemented and to ensure that the roles are updated for the new SHA's. The patch update of Ansible is routine. If we were to update the minor version of ansible, then we would update our minor revision as that would be a significant change.

@Doug The option to enable the ARA plugin install was always there, this just exposed it in a slightly more broader and simpler way. We could do a minor revision if you wish, but it is not a significant change to us - it doesn't change any default behavior and is opt-in."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-26 14:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:20:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @Tony Every OSA minor upgrade involves running bootstrap-ansible.sh
 > again, both to ensure the correct ansible version is implemented
 > and to ensure that the roles are updated for the new SHA's. The
 > patch update of Ansible is routine. If we were to update the minor
 > version of ansible, then we would update our minor revision as that
 > would be a significant change.
 > 
 > @Doug The option to enable the ARA plugin install was always there,
 > this just exposed it in a slightly more broader and simpler way. We
 > could do a minor revision if you wish, but it is not a significant
 > change to us - it doesn't change any default behavior and is
 > opt-in.

Nothing to add there, thanks Jesse for the comments :)"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-11-28 10:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LGTM, but holding until Doug / Tony get a chance to review the answers'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-28 10:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> LGTM, but holding until Doug / Tony get a chance to review the
 > answers

 > At the very least https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614308/1 (
 > Update ansible to 2.4.6) confuses me in the context of users that
 > have an existing OSA install (say 17.1.3) if they grab 17.1.4
 > should that re-run the bootstrap-aio,sh and therefore get a new
 > ansible or do they bypass that step?
 > 
 > If I read https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/latest/admin/upgrades/minor-updates.html
 > correctly that change will only impact new OSA sites?
 > 
 > #help?

@Tony: I forgot to add: bootstrap-aio is only for aio purposes and is for generating the configuration. You should run it once and it should be good. 

The bootstrap-ansible is to get ansible and the latest roles. No user level change there.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-30 19:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-12-03 16:21:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm OK with this as-is after seeing the description of the changes. I'll wait to give Tony a chance to comment before proceeding."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-03 23:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay looks good to me

Thanks.'}]

commit_message:
Improve security groups management.

- Add create_security_group_rule method to base class
  to make easier creating rules for IPv6 test cases.
- Add delete_security_group method.
- Make sure segurity groups are deleted using the
  client that has been used to create them.
- Improve security group client handling.

Change-Id: I50858d5198d8a70a2bb9fb278786c433d7cb12ca

[{'created': '2018-11-18 09:01:25.000000000', 'message': 'Do not include node scale up playbook in case of new masters

Openshift-ansible gives us a friendly error when we do:

"Please run playbooks/openshift-master/scaleup.yml if you need to scale
up both masters and nodes. This playbook is only needed if you are only
adding new nodes and not new masters"

Change-Id: Ibf52b9dbabc9a4f86c11b7de345c3b73e157435c
Closes-Bug: #1802324
(cherry picked from commit 8caaee30a96f71de5e84137e4854bcd92b773f6f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not include node scale up playbook in case of new masters

Openshift-ansible gives us a friendly error when we do:

"Please run playbooks/openshift-master/scaleup.yml if you need to scale
up both masters and nodes. This playbook is only needed if you are only
adding new nodes and not new masters"

Change-Id: Ibf52b9dbabc9a4f86c11b7de345c3b73e157435c
Closes-Bug: #1802324
(cherry picked from commit 8caaee30a96f71de5e84137e4854bcd92b773f6f)
